programDescription: City Internships for College Students
activityDescription: Internships and work-study opportunities for college students to gain practical experience in various fields.

programDescription: The Fire Cadet Company 511 program offers young adults an opportunity to explore a career in the fire service.
activityDescription: Young adults seeking a career as a Seattle firefighter can apply to participate in our department's cadet programs. Participants must be in good physical condition and have a strong desire to be a Seattle Firefighter. The program includes physical ability tests, attendance expectations, and encourages applications from diverse communities.
cost: $95 initial cost and $10 per month in membership dues. Additional fees for special trips and events. Financial assistance is available.

programDescription: Free ORCA cards for Seattle Public Schools Students
activityDescription: Provided fully-subsidized ORCA cards for 20,000 Seattle Public School middle and high school students.

programDescription: Temporary, unlimited, and fully-subsidized ORCA card provided to essential workers.
activityDescription: Provided to food service and grocery/convenience store employees working in specific neighborhoods.

programDescription: Provided ORCA LIFT cards pre-loaded with funds to support low-income individuals.
activityDescription: Distributed ORCA LIFT cards to new enrollees and individuals renewing their enrollment.

programDescription: Free passes to local museums for Library card holders.
activityDescription: Use your Library card to get free admission to participating Seattle museums. Enjoy exhibits on aviation, nature, science, and industry—all for free! You may reserve one pass per calendar month.

programDescription: Get Engaged with any Board or Commission (18-29)
activityDescription: The Get Engaged program places young adults, ages 18-29, on the City of Seattle’s public boards and commissions. Get Engaged board members serve a one-year term starting September each year. Acting in an advisory capacity to the Mayor and City Council, board members help shape policy decisions, make recommendations, and provide citizen participation in city government.

organizationName: Office of Immigrant and Refugee Affairs
programDescription: The Immigrant Family Institute was a program that brought together youth from immigrant families, their parents/guardians/caregivers, and Seattle police officers to learn from each other.
activityDescription: Participants met regularly for two to four hours, engaging in discussions led by community facilitators. The program included resources to ensure full participation, such as meals, transportation support, and interpretation services.

programDescription: The Children, Youth and Young Adult Division supports an array of programs to help youth and young adults thrive. Programs are focused on education, employment, housing and rental support, as well as legal system assistance.
activityDescription: Programs that help young people get beyond barriers and achieve their education and employment goals.

programDescription: Community and Human service programs that help young people get beyond barriers and achieve their education and employment goals.
activityDescription: Programs focused on education and employment for youth, providing resources and support to help them succeed.

programDescription: Find featured services and learn how to search for providers. King County’s Youth and Family Homelessness Prevention Initiative (YFHPI) steps in quickly with landlords and housing providers.
activityDescription: Resources aimed at preventing homelessness and helping youth find stable housing.

programDescription: Support for youth in the legal system available from Community and Human Services.
activityDescription: Services available through community partners to assist youth involved in the legal system.

programDescription: Learning Buddies is a program where elementary age students read with a high school mentor and play math and reading games.
activityDescription: Elementary age students read with a high school mentor and play math and reading games. Drop-in, first come, first served, one hour sessions to build math and reading skills.

programDescription: The Library’s Student Assistant Program is designed for students to gain work experience while assisting in library operations.
activityDescription: Student Assistants work at the Library from 12 to 15 hours per week, assisting with various tasks and gaining valuable work experience. Positions are temporary and can be held for up to two years if enrolled in school.

programDescription: Temporary Lifeguards for eight indoor pools in Seattle. Current Red Cross Lifeguard certification is required, and candidates must be at least 16 years old to apply.
activityDescription: Participants will receive training and certification in lifeguarding, First Aid, and CPR/AED. The program includes practical methods and theory for teaching lifeguarding skills.

programDescription: The Lifeguard Training Team is a FREE summer program designed to train and certify Seattle's youth in lifesaving skills.
activityDescription: An eight-week program for youth ages 15-18 that trains participants to be lifeguards and build job skills. Includes a full American Red Cross lifeguard training course.

programDescription: This American Red Cross course is your first step in becoming a lifeguard for the City of Seattle.
activityDescription: The course is approximately 30 hours in length and provides certification in Lifeguarding, First Aid, and CPR/AED. Certifications are valid for two years.

programDescription: Local Teen Counseling Resources for youth aged 12-21.
activityDescription: Provides mental health services including assessments, counseling for mental health and substance abuse issues, and referrals to mental health and substance abuse services.
cost: Provides services regardless of ability to pay. Accepts WA Apple Health (Medicaid) for some services. Some private insurance is accepted.

programDescription: School-Based Health Services offered at Washington Middle School Wellness Center.
activityDescription: Offers a comprehensive scope of health services to youth and adolescents including asthma care, immunizations, treatment of simple illnesses and injuries, family planning, physical exams, health education, and mental health services.
location: 2101 South Jackson Street, Washington Middle School, Seattle, WA 98144
cost: Provides services regardless of ability to pay. Accepts WA Apple Health (Medicaid) for some services. Some private insurance is accepted.

programDescription: Free virtual tutoring for K – 12 students in Seattle.
activityDescription: K – 12 students can get free virtual tutoring from Tutor.com with a Library card or Library Link number. Tutors are available in English, Spanish, and Vietnamese, helping with subjects like Math, Writing, Science, History, AP Classes, and more.
times: 2 PM - 10 PM (English and Spanish), 4 PM - 7 PM (Vietnamese)
cost: Free with Library card or Library Link number

programDescription: Parks and Recreation Volunteering
activityDescription: Participants can engage in various volunteer opportunities to help maintain and improve Seattle's parks, including park inspections, trail building, and environmental education.

programDescription: The mission of the Seattle Police Law Enforcement Exploring program is to bridge the gap between youth and police by educating and involving them in police operations and to interest them in Law Enforcement.
activityDescription: Explorers have many opportunities to apply the training they receive during monthly meetings. Members volunteer at community events doing security work, directing traffic, and providing overall community service. They learn about law enforcement through various programs and projects featuring safety, training, and service.

programDescription: A youth mental health initiative focused on creating a healthier future for Seattle kids.
activityDescription: This initiative seeks to bridge the gap between youth and the limited professional mental health resources available to them, focusing on prevention and early identification of mental health challenges.

programDescription: Seattle Mentors is a mayoral initiative focused on youth mentorship managed by Seattle Parks & Recreation with a collaborative approach amongst city departments, and other public and private sectors in Seattle.
activityDescription: Seattle Mentors promotes impactful mentorship, social/emotional health, and career exposure opportunities, where young people connect with one or more caring adults. The program includes various mentoring opportunities aimed at empowering youth to reach their full potential.

programDescription: Seattle Promise is a college tuition and success program launched by Seattle Colleges, Seattle Public Schools, and the City of Seattle following passage of the Families, Education, Preschool, and Promise (FEPP) Levy in 2018.
activityDescription: Seattle Promise covers any remaining tuition balance for up to two years (or 90 credits) at one of the Seattle Colleges after other public funding, grants or scholarships a student may be eligible to receive have been applied. It also provides financial support for college costs beyond tuition including school-related expenses such as books, child care, food, housing, and transportation.

programDescription: The Seattle Youth Employment Program (SYEP) supports young people (ages 16 to 24) from qualifying-income households and communities that experience racial, social, and economic disparities. The goal is to increase youth and young adults' ability to pursue careers that pay well and are meaningful to them.
activityDescription: SYEP features two programs to help you develop skills for life and work: the Learn & Earn Program and the Internship Program. Participants identify professional interests, gain marketable skills, and are placed in professional work settings to apply their knowledge and gain hands-on experience.
cost: $20.76 per hour for internships; stipends of $325 for Learn & Earn participants

programDescription: Educational lessons about mental health, depression and suicide.
activityDescription: Educational lessons about mental health, depression and suicide.

programDescription: Good mental health clubs to empower young people.
activityDescription: Mental health clubs empower young people to change the world.

programDescription: Programs and resources for families to be partners in mental health.
activityDescription: Programs and resources for families to be partners in mental health.

programDescription: Staff training, well-being activities and more for a positive climate.
activityDescription: Staff training, well-being activities and more for a positive climate.

programDescription: Campaigns that impact whole school communities.
activityDescription: Campaigns that impact whole school communities.

programDescription: Tools that help schools make data-informed decisions.
activityDescription: Tools that help schools make data-informed decisions.

programDescription: 5v5 Men's Flag Football - Friday Reign City Fall League
activityName: 5v5 Men's Flag Football - Friday Reign City Fall League
activityDescription: Participate in a competitive 5v5 men's flag football league.

programDescription: 8v8 Coed Flag Football - Friday Reign City Fall League
activityName: 8v8 Coed Flag Football - Friday Reign City Fall League
activityDescription: Join a coed flag football league with 8 players on each team.

programDescription: Coed Pickleball League (Adults Only)
activityDescription: Engage in a coed pickleball league designed for adults.

programDescription: Youth Volleyball 10-11 yrs (Ballard)
activityDescription: Youth volleyball program for children aged 10-11 at Ballard Community Center.
ageRange: Age at least 10 yrs but less than 12 yrs

programDescription: Youth Volleyball 10-11 yrs (Bitter Lake)
activityDescription: Youth volleyball program for children aged 10-11 at Bitter Lake Community Center.
ageRange: Age at least 10 yrs but less than 12 yrs

programDescription: Join us for an exciting summer serving community as a Seattle Parks and Recreation temporary employee! We are seeking motivated, enthusiastic individuals for a variety of positions this summer to provide welcoming and safe opportunities to play, learn, contemplate, and build community and promote responsible stewardship of the land.
activityDescription: Employment opportunities are open to individuals ages 16 and up, or 18 and up for some positions. Some positions require a WA State driver’s license, or other certifications. Please review individual job postings for more details.

programDescription: Join our team to help monitor swimmer safety, rescue persons in distress, and lead instructional programs to help community develop swimming skills.
activityDescription: Temporary Lifeguards may work summer-only positions at our 9 swim beaches and 2 outdoor pools, and/or year-round positions at our 8 indoor pools.

programDescription: Wading Pool Attendants work an average of 24 hours a week but can work up to 40 hours if needed. Season runs mid-June to Labor Day.
activityDescription: Oversee the operation of wading pool. Clean, fill, drain, and maintain the water quality of the wading pool and surrounding area. Act as the on-site relations representative of Parks and Recreation. Perform first aid and handle incidents as they arise.

programDescription: We are hiring for multiple positions to deliver responsible, exceptional recreation services through summer playground, summer sack lunch, and food and fitness programs.
activityName: Summer Food and Fitness Recreation Attendant
activityDescription: Responsibilities include park site setup and cleanup, proper food storage and record keeping, and other recreation program duties as assigned.

programDescription: Seattle Parks and Recreation - Specialized Programs is excited to announce that we are hiring Recreation Attendants for our youth summer programs.
activityName: Summer Recreation Attendant for Youths with Disabilities
activityDescription: This summer Specialized Programs is running day camps and overnight camps for youths with developmental/intellectual disabilities.

programDescription: Seattle Parks and Recreation - Specialized Programs is excited to announce that we are hiring Recreation Attendants for our adult summer programs.
activityName: Summer Recreation Attendant for Adults with Disabilities
activityDescription: This summer Specialized Programs is running city-wide day programs for adults with developmental/intellectual disabilities.

programDescription: Free online support and therapy for Seattle youth ages 13-24.
activityName: Free Online Therapy for Seattle Youth
activityDescription: Participants can access Talkspace therapy and self-guided support at no cost, including messaging their therapist anytime and scheduling one live session per month.

programDescription: Job Readiness Opportunities for Teens - Parks offers various job readiness programs, internships, and support for employment pathways for teens aged 14-24.
activityDescription: This program provides instruction on writing resumes, practicing interviews, and learning communication skills. It includes pre-employment training and various job opportunities, primarily during the summer.

programDescription: Pre-Employment Training is a job readiness training program for young people ages 13-19.
activityDescription: This training program occurs during Fall, Winter, and Spring, providing instruction on writing resumes, practicing interviews, and learning communication skills. Each class meets twice a week for 2 hours.

programDescription: College Tours provide teens with a glimpse of college life and the opportunity to explore various fields of study.
activityDescription: Organized every quarter, these tours allow students to learn about college experiences, costs, financial support, and fields of study.

programDescription: Basketball Scorers and Timers are needed during the basketball season at community centers.
activityDescription: Candidates must attend mandatory training and be available to work on Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays from January through March, earning $20 an hour.

programDescription: Workshops offered at various Teen Life Centers and community centers provide information on job preparation, college applications, and more.
activityDescription: These workshops are unpaid but provide valuable information on job prep, college applications, banking, and work performance improvements.

programDescription: Seattle Mentors provides safe, supportive environments for youth to learn, grow, and reach adulthood.
activityDescription: A program that connects youth with mentors to help them navigate their personal and professional development.

programDescription: Youth Employment and Service Learning (YESL) offers a wide range of service-learning and community service opportunities.
activityDescription: Provides youth with opportunities for community service and employment, requiring documentation of service hours.

programDescription: Teen Life Centers offer a variety of programming including special events, computer labs, and social recreation.
activityDescription: Provides a safe environment for teens with various activities including Late Night Programs on weekends.

programDescription: A 9-week program focusing on youth of color to introduce them to theater through workshops.
activityDescription: Participants engage in performing arts workshops to develop self-discipline, confidence, and teamwork.

programDescription: Community Learning Centers (CLC) provide out-of-school time programs at Seattle Public School sites.
activityDescription: Offers academic and enrichment programs during and after school, serving approximately 3,300 students each year.

programDescription: Programs and services to help students of all ages succeed in school.
activityDescription: We offer academic coaching, one-on-one tutoring, college prep resources and more.

programDescription: The Youth Civic Engagement Program (YCEP) equips Seattle high school students with skills to drive powerful change in their communities through policy and advocacy experiences.
activityDescription: Participants will learn about local government and the legislative process, receive mentorship, write an advocacy letter about an issue they care about, meet elected representatives, gain leadership and advocacy skills, and have fun.
dates: February 22, March 22, April 26, May 17, with a final in-person session in June or July

programDescription: Healthcare & Wellness services for women.
activityDescription: Provides healthcare services specifically for women.

programDescription: Mentorship and pro-social recreational activities for youth.
activityDescription: Offers mentorship and fun recreational activities for youth aged 12-24.

programDescription: Provides various support services including financial assistance and housing.
activityDescription: Offers financial assistance, housing support, pro-social youth development, and violence prevention services.

programDescription: Offers case management, counseling, and job readiness programs.
activityDescription: Provides case management, mental health counseling, housing support, job readiness, and substance use services.

programDescription: Provides education and legal services.
activityDescription: Offers classes and legal services for youth aged 3-99.

organizationName: ADWAS: Abused Deaf Women's Advocacy Services
programDescription: Advocacy and counseling services for domestic violence victims.
activityDescription: Provides advocacy, mental health counseling, and shelter services for domestic violence victims.

programDescription: Mentorship and pro-social youth development.
activityDescription: Offers mentorship and pro-social youth development activities for all youth.

programDescription: Support for youth dealing with substance use issues.
activityDescription: Provides mentorship and support for youth dealing with substance use.

programDescription: Mentorship and pro-social youth development activities.
activityDescription: Offers mentorship, recreational activities, and youth development programs for ages 12-24.

organizationName: ANEW - Apprenticeship and Pre Apprenticeship Support
programDescription: Job readiness programs for youth.
activityDescription: Provides job readiness training for all youth.

programDescription: Support services for homeless youth.
activityDescription: Provides advocacy, food, and housing support for homeless youth.

programDescription: The Youth Transportation Ambassadors program is a paid learning opportunity for youth to learn about transportation planning and engage in community-centered education.
activityDescription: Participants will go on weekly field trips, gain valuable skills in transportation project planning, job shadow experts, and work on real projects in their community.
location: Seattle Municipal Tower – 700 5th Ave, Seattle, WA 98104
cost: $600 stipend at the end of the program
